title: ggplot2 Plots for the vegan Package
text: ggvegan package R statistical software environment. aims implement ggplot-based versions plots produced vegan package. Initially, ggvegan provides fortify() autoplot() methods objects created vegan, aim providing full replacement plots via autoplot(). fortify() methods allow data contained within objects created vegan converted format suitable use ggplot() directly.

title: ggplot2 Plots for the vegan Package
text: ggvegan released GNU General Public Licence, version 2.

title: ggplot2 Plots for the vegan Package
text: ggvegan uses roxygen2 system document package functions alongside code . ggvegan much beta code moment. Comments feedback approach taken welcome, code contributions. See Design decisions important areas consideration.

title: ggplot2 Plots for the vegan Package
text: autoplot() concept somewhat poorly defined moment — least public. taken mean full ggplot object returned, can augmented additional layers changes scales etc. means aesthetics scores hard-coded autoplot() methods. want greater control aesthetics, use fortify() return scores suitable format build plot . hope include least one example , applicable, help pages autoplot() method.

title: ggplot2 Plots for the vegan Package
text: fortify() methods supposed return data frame necessarily convenient representation vegan’s ordination objects several data frames representing various sets ordination scores natural. Currently, ggvegan follows existing fortify() convention returning single data frame returns ordination scores long format variables score indicating type score label label/rowname score.

title: ggplot2 Plots for the vegan Package
text: first two columns now score label. remaining columns requested ordination dimensions, named per scores method vegan. example, PCA columns named pc1, pc2, etc. many numbering depending axes argument; default 1:6. design decision ggvegan’s fortify() methods ordination objects return possible sets scores default, set returned can chosen user using layers argument. Additionally, sets scores plotted can chosen autoplot() stage.

title: ggplot2 Plots for the vegan Package
text: components returned specialised objects typically vary needed sensible, tidy data representation. fortify() methods return suitable components. example, fortify.prc() returns components time, treatment, response corresponding two-way factors defining experiment regression coefficients RDA axis 1 respectively.

title: ggplot2 Plots for the vegan Package
text: following autoplot methods currently available autoplot.cca — objects classes "cca" "capscale" autoplot.rda — objects class "rda" autoplot.metaMDS — objects class "metaMDS" autoplot.prc — objects class "prc" autoplot.decorana — objects class "decorana" (AKA DCA) autoplot.prestonfit — objects class "prestonfit" autoplot.fisherfit — objects class "fisherfit" autoplot.envfit — objects class "envfit" autoplot.isomap — objects class "isomap" autoplot.permustats — objects class "permustats" autoplot.poolaccum — objects class "poolaccum" autoplot.anosim — objects class "anosim" autoplot.vegan_pco — objects class "vegan_pco" autoplot.dbrda — objects class "dbrda" following fortify method currently available fortify.cca — objects classes "cca", "capscale" fortify.rda — objects classes "rda" fortify.metaMDS — objects class "metaMDS" fortify.prc — objects class "prc" fortify.decorana — objects class "decorana" (AKA DCA) fortify.prestonfit — objects class "prestonfit" fortify.fisherfit — objects class "fisherfit" fortify.anosim — objects class "anosim" fortify.isomap — objects class "isomap" fortify.permustats — objects class "permustats" fortify.poolaccum — objects class "poolaccum" fortify.renyiaccum — objects class "renyiaccum" fortify.vegan_pco — objects class "vegan_pco" fortify.dbrda — objects class "dbrda"

title: ggplot2 Plots for the vegan Package
text: can install ggvegan directly GitHub using functions remotes package provides. , install remotes CRAN via run doesn’t work prefer install binaries, R Universe service run rOpenSci now provides binaries. Instruction install ggvegan repository :
code: install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("gavinsimpson/ggvegan") # Enable repository from gavinsimpson options(repos = c(   gavinsimpson = "https://gavinsimpson.r-universe.dev",   CRAN = "https://cloud.r-project.org")) # Download and install ggvegan in R install.packages("ggvegan")

New best solution #> ... Procrustes: rmse 0.04163008  max resid 0.151824  #> Run 4 stress 0.1825658  #> ... Procrustes: rmse 2.44659e-05  max resid 8.075038e-05  #> ... Similar to previous best #> Run 5 stress 0.1969805  #> Run 6 stress 0.196245  #> Run 7 stress 0.224895  #> Run 8 stress 0.1967393  #> Run 9 stress 0.2048307  #> Run 10 stress 0.2032569  #> Run 11 stress 0.2095882  #> Run 12 stress 0.1955836  #> Run 13 stress 0.1825658  #> ... New best solution #> ... Procrustes: rmse 5.865506e-06  max resid 1.5389e-05  #> ... Similar to previous best #> Run 14 stress 0.18584  #> Run 15 stress 0.2141074  #> Run 16 stress 0.2032569  #> Run 17 stress 0.2085949  #> Run 18 stress 0.18458  #> Run 19 stress 0.195049  #> Run 20 stress 0.18458  #> *** Best solution repeated 1 times fit1 <- envfit(ord1, varechem, perm = 199)  autoplot(fit1, geom = 'label_repel')   data(dune, dune.env) ord2 <- cca(dune) fit2 <- envfit(ord2 ~ Moisture + A1, dune.env, perm = 199)  autoplot(fit2)

title: Autoplot Graphics for vegan permustats Objects — autoplot.permustats
code: library("vegan")  data(dune, dune.env) mod <- cca(dune ~ A1 + Management + Moisture, dune.env) (ano <- anova(mod, by = "onedf")) #> Permutation test for cca under reduced model #> Sequential test for contrasts #> Permutation: free #> Number of permutations: 999 #>  #> Model: cca(formula = dune ~ A1 + Management + Moisture, data = dune.env) #>              Df ChiSquare      F Pr(>F)     #> A1            1   0.22476 2.7632  0.009 **  #> ManagementHF  1   0.13890 1.7076  0.054 .   #> ManagementNM  1   0.28099 3.4545  0.001 *** #> ManagementSF  1   0.13512 1.6612  0.077 .   #> Moisture.L    1   0.21976 2.7017  0.002 **  #> Moisture.Q    1   0.05769 0.7093  0.722     #> Moisture.C    1   0.08193 1.0073  0.358     #> Residual     12   0.97610                   #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1 pstat <- permustats(ano) head(fortify(pstat)) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   term  permutation #>   <fct>       <dbl> #> 1 A1          -2.10 #> 2 A1          -2.06 #> 3 A1          -2.21 #> 4 A1          -2.00 #> 5 A1          -2.06 #> 6 A1          -1.74 autoplot(pstat, "box")    if (requireNamespace("ggplot2")) {   library("ggplot2")    # avoid overplotting x-axis text   autoplot(pstat, "violin") +     scale_x_discrete(guide = guide_axis(n.dodge = 2))    autoplot(pstat, "qqnorm", facet = TRUE) +     geom_qq_line() }   autoplot(pstat, "density", facet = TRUE)

title: Create a ggplot Object — ordiggplot
text: ggvegan package two contrasting approaches draw ordination plots. autoplot functions (e.g. autoplot.rda(), autoplot.cca(), autoplot.metaMDS) draw complete plot one command, design hard-coded function. However, can add new elements graph. contrast, function ordiggplot() sets ordination plot, draw anything. allows add layers plot one one full flexibility ggplot2 functions. specific functions geom_ordi_* functions similar similarly named geom_* functions. need give type ordination scores added, addition, can give geom_* function arguments modify plot. Alternatively, can use ggplot2 function data argument use ggscores() function select data elements function. ordiggplot() function extracts results using fortify() functions package, accepts arguments functions. allows setting, e.g., scaling ordination axes.

title: Create a ggplot Object — ordiggplot
code: library("vegan") library("ggplot2") data(dune, dune.env, varespec, varechem) m <- cca(dune ~ Management + A1, dune.env)  ## use geom_ordi_* functions ordiggplot(m) + geom_ordi_axis() +   geom_ordi_point("sites") +   geom_ordi_text("species", col = "darkblue",                  mapping = aes(fontface = "italic")) +   geom_ordi_label("centroids") +   geom_ordi_arrow("biplot")   ## use ggscores + standard geom_* functions ordiggplot(m, scaling = "sites") +   geom_point(data = ggscores("sites")) +   geom_text(data = ggscores("species"),             mapping = aes(fontface = "italic")) +   geom_label(data = ggscores("centroids"), fill = "yellow") +   geom_ordi_arrow("biplot")   ## Messy arrow biplot for PCA m <- rda(dune) ordiggplot(m) +   geom_ordi_axis() +   geom_ordi_point("sites") +   geom_ordi_arrow("species")
